Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; possibly traces of band in added white at top of sherd; parts of three tongues alternating white and added red; exterior: painted decoration consisting possibly of curling tail of lion; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 73 (?) is written in pencil on the interior. Possibly the number Φ3, but fragmentary.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1946) (phase 2)
